allowance."},"BeaconUpgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the beacon is changed."},"Initialized(uint8)":{"details":"Triggered when the contract has been initialized or Note that `value` may be zero."},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-allowance}."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"earned(address)":{"params":{"_user":"User to view the earned rewards for"},"returns":{"earnedAmounts":"Amounts of the user's earned rewards","rewardTokens":"Address array of the rewards"}},"earned(address,address)":{"params":{"_reward":"Reward to calculate the earned amount for","_user":"User to view the earned reward for"},"returns":{"earnedAmount":"Amount of the user's earned reward"}},"exit()":{"details":"Burns all receipt tokens owned by the caller"},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"initialize(address)":{"params":{"_stakedToken":"BALUNI token address"}},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"notifyRewardAmount(address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Must approve this contract to spend the reward amount before calling this function. New rewards will be assigned a id using their address and the block timestamp.","params":{"_amount":"Amount of reward","_duration":"Duration of the reward distribution in seconds","_reward":"Address of the reward"}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"removeReward(address,address)":{"details":"All unclaimed earnings are ignored. Re-adding the reward will have a new set of reward information so any unclaimed earnings cannot be recovered","params":{"_recipient":"Address of the recipient that the removed reward was sent to","_reward":"Address of the reward to be removed"}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"rescueTokens(address,address)":{"params":{"_recipient":"Address of the recipient that the removed token was sent to","_token":"Address of the token to be documentation.text: @notice BALUNI token address
@notice Array of reward addresses
@notice Whitelist of manager addresses
@dev Limit to the number of rewards an owner can add
@dev Location of a reward in the reward array

@dev Each reward address has a new unique identifier each time it is initialized. This is
 to prevent old mappings from being reused when removing and re-adding a reward.
@dev Each identifier relates to reward information
@notice User has staked an amount
@notice User has withdrawn an amount
@notice A reward has been paid to the user
@notice A new reward has been added to be distributed
@notice More of an existing reward has been added to be distributed
@notice A reward has been removed from distribution and sent to the recipient
@notice The owner has removed tokens that are not supported by this contract
@notice An address has been added to or removed from the whitelist
@notice Caller is not a manager
@notice The staked token cannot be added as a reward
@notice The duration is too short to be set
@notice There are already too many rewards
@notice The reward has not been found in the array
@notice The owner cannot withdraw the staked token
@notice the owner cannot withdraw an existing reward without first removing it from the array

@dev Triggers reward updates on every user interaction
 @param _user Address of the user making an interaction
@dev Only a manager can call these modified functions

@notice Initialize the contract, callable only once
 @param _stakedToken BALUNI token address

@notice Withdraw all of the caller's BALUNI tokens and claim rewards
 @dev Burns all receipt tokens owned by the caller
@notice Claim all the caller's earned rewards

documentation.text:
@dev Update the rewards and earnings for a user
 @param _user Address to update the earnings for

@dev Withdraw BALUNI tokens and burn an equal number of receipt tokens from the caller
 @param _amount Amount of BALUNI to withdraw
